apple: A round fruit with red or green skin and a white inside.
application: A formal request to an authority for something.
apricot: A juicy, soft fruit, resembling a small peach.
banana: A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.
backend: The part of a software system that is not directly accessed by the user.
bug: An error, flaw or fault in a computer program.
code: Instructions for a computer, written in a programming language.
computer: An electronic device for storing and processing data.
data: Facts and statistics collected together for reference or analysis.
debug: The process of identifying and removing errors from computer hardware or software.
frontend: The part of a software system that is directly accessed by the user.
java: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language.
javascript: A programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web.
server: A computer or system that provides resources, data, services, or programs to other computers.
spring: A Java framework that makes it easy to create enterprise-grade applications.
